Remove photo First name Last name Email Password (6+ characters) ,  ,  .   Already on LinkedIn? . .  Sign in to save Carbon Data Analyst at Terrascope . Email or phone Password Show Forgot password? Sign in Report this job Empowering enterprises to keep the planet habitable for all! Reversing the impact of climate change is one of the world’s biggest challenges. And businesses have a responsibility to lead the way. While individual consumer choices are important, over 80% of all the emissions reductions necessary for the world to reach Net-Zero, require business-level action. But despite the growing momentum and ambition from companies around the world to set Net-Zero goals, there are significant challenges to delivering on these ambitions. Business leaders don’t really know how they will get there. And the very first step, of getting emissions measurement right, is hard. Terrascope is an enterprise-grade, end-to-end decarbonisation SaaS platform. By combining AI-assisted carbon measurement & management with deep industry & sustainability expertise, Terrascope helps solve the data management, emissions reduction planning and implementation challenges that large enterprises face to decarbonise their operations and complex supply chains. Publicly launched in June '22, Terrascope is working with customers in multiple industry verticals such as agriculture, food & beverage and consumer packaged goods, as well as horizontals such as manufacturing, technology, transportation and real estate. Terrascope is an innovative player to support enterprises in their green transformation. Backed by Nupo Ventures (formerly Olam Ventures) and incubated with support from BCG X, Terrascope has now achieved a number of globally recognised accreditations, with more on the way – including being the first CDP Gold Accredited Software provider from Asia and signing The Climate Pledge to be net zero by 2040. Terrascope aims to lead by example and demonstrate that business growth and carbon reduction can go hand in hand. We are looking for a Carbon Data Analyst to join the team. You will play the crucial role of implementing a clients first carbon measurement on our carbon platform. Your learnings as you work through this process will feed back to the product development team to further improve yours and the clients user experience on the platform. This role reports into our Head of Implementation. In this role you will: Collaborate with our Customer Success Managers and interface with the client to define the data required to complete a customer’s organisational carbon measurement Work with customers to help them provide the correct data required for calculation. Provide guidance on what additional data is required to enrich raw data sets for footprint measurement Transform unstructured data sets provided by clients into structured data which can be ingested into our products data processing pipeline to calculate carbon emissions Use our platform to calculate, map, and publish carbon footprints that will be used by a company for its carbon measurement, management, and reporting. Provide feedback and learnings to our product development team to improve your workflow and extend the platform's capabilities You should be/have: At least 2 years of relevant experience in a data analytics role Skills in writing SQL queries, data engineering and structuring skills, or have a quantitative background with a desire to learn Proficiency in Python Be detail oriented and willing to make sense of unstructured data. You understand how numbers from an excel sheet translate to real world transactions and operations. A strong ownership of your work, and are comfortable working in a client facing role A strong verbal and written communicator who can simplify and communicate complex concepts to a novice audience Excited to be part of a team that is looking to solve climate change, and are passionate about this space Bonus: You have prior experience in climate or sustainability related industry and knowledge on Green House Gas Accounting Principles We're committed to creating an inclusive environment for our strong and diverse team. We value diversity and foster a community where everyone can be his or her authentic self. Sign in Report this job Working as part of the Global NetSuite support team, the role will play a crucial role in harnessing the power of our Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) system to provide actionable insights and support informed decision-making. Your primary responsibilities will include extracting, analysing, and visualising data from various ERP modules, ensuring data accuracy, and collaborating with cross-functional teams. Leveraging your technical and analytical skills, you will contribute to optimising business processes and enhancing the overall efficiency of our organisation. The role shall require strong coordination and planning skills, as well as a deep understanding of Enterprise Resource Planning systems. Ideally suited to a person with a blend of abilities including strong technical knowledge (Accountancy & ERP) with an aptitude for detailed analysis, methodical working, loyalty, teamwork, and customer focus. Key Responsibilities Include: Data Extraction & Integration: Extracting data from various modules and databases within the ERP system. Integrating data from different sources to provide a comprehensive view. Data Analysis & Reporting: Analysing large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and insights. Creating reports and dashboards using tools like Power BI or other reporting tools. Database Management: Managing and maintaining the integrity of the ERP database. Ensuring data accuracy, consistency, and completeness. SQL Querying: Writing and executing SQL queries to retrieve and manipulate data within the ERP database. Data Cleansing & Quality Assurance: Cleaning and pre-processing data to ensure accuracy and reliability. Implementing data quality checks and measures. Customisation & Configuration: Configuring the ERP system to meet specific reporting and analytical requirements. Customising reports and dashboards based on user needs. Diagnostics & Issue Resolution: Identifying and resolving data-related issues or discrepancies within the ERP system. Collaborating with NS & IT support teams to address technical problems. User Training & Support: Providing training to end-users on how to use reporting tools and interpret data. Offering support to users experiencing difficulties with data access or analysis. Security & Compliance: Ensuring data security within the ERP system. Adhering to industry regulations and compliance standards related to data management. Collaboration With Stakeholders: Collaborating with various teams to understand their data requirements. Working closely with group finance, GMC group, and executives to provide data-driven insights. Ad-hoc Analysis: Conducting ad hoc analyses based on specific business inquiries or challenges. Responding to urgent data requests from management. Skills Required: ERP System Knowledge: Strong understanding of enterprise resource planning (ERP) systems Up-to-date knowledge & experience of NetSuite ERP platform would be advantageous. Proficiency in navigating and extracting data from ERP systems. Data Analysis & Reporting: Strong analytical skills to interpret complex data sets and identify trends, patterns, and insights. Proficiency in data visualisation tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI) to create meaningful reports and dashboards. SQL & Databases: Proficiency in SQL (Structured Query Language) for querying and manipulating data within the ERP database. Understanding of database structures and relationships. Excel: Advanced skills in Excel for data manipulation, analysis, and reporting. Strong knowledge of Excel functions and formulas. Business Intelligence (BI) Tools: Familiarity with BI tools beyond Excel, such as Power BI, Tableau, or Qlik, to create interactive and dynamic reports. Programming & Scripting: Basic programming skills can be beneficial, especially if the ERP system allows customisation or if there's a need for automation. Knowledge of scripting languages (e.g., Python) for data manipulation and automation. Data Cleansing & Quality Management: Ability to clean and pre-process data to ensure accuracy and reliability. Understanding of data quality management practices. Communication: Strong communication skills to convey complex data findings to non-technical stakeholders. Ability to work collaboratively with different teams and departments. Self-starter. Problem-Solving Skills: Adept at identifying and solving data-related issues or discrepancies within the ERP system. Project management: Ability to manage and prioritise tasks effectively, especially when dealing with large datasets and complex analyses. Project Management: Ability to manage and prioritise tasks effectively, especially when dealing with large datasets and complex analyses. ERP Security & Compliance: Understanding of ERP security protocols to ensure data integrity and compliance with industry regulations. Continuous Learning: Given the evolving nature of ERP systems and technologies, a willingness to stay updated on the latest trends and advancements in data analytics. Other: Strong accountancy & financial skills; qualified member of an accountancy body or holder of an equivalent qualification would be highly desirable. Results focused, unrelenting focus on business outcomes. Experience working with people with a diverse range of skills, cultures, and work environments across a wide geographic area. Ability to set clear tasks and expectations for others; follow progress against tasks; provide regular feedback; address performance issues; foster learning and development; provide public recognition of team accomplishments. Delegate wisely; giving others the opportunity to act and make decisions. Develop capability and building confidence in others. Makes decisions effectively (i.e., timely, with available information/ perspectives). Effective communicator and influencer - Present ideas and concepts that enables understanding, gain buy-in, and generates support from peers, dependencies, and stakeholders. Confident and persuasive both in a formal and informal setting. Shares knowledge and information at right time with right people. Sets own goals and objectives easily and prioritises own responsibilities and assists others to prioritise tasks & activities reflecting departmental and group objectives. This is a highly networked role that requires an ability to work under pressure and to challenging deadlines. Other Responsibilities Linked To This Role: Identifying opportunities for process improvement and efficiency within the ERP data management workflow. Work cross-functionally with a variety of teams, including Product, Marketing and Operations teams to advocate for partner needs. Minimum Qualifications 4+ years experience in data analysis or a similar technical operations role. BS/BA in a highly quantitative field, such as Economics, Statistics, Business commerce, or equivalent experience preferred. Experience in working with analytical tools (e.g SQL, Python, Business Intelligence/dashboards). Strong analytical skills with the ability to generate compelling product and business recommendations Exceptional communication and presentation skills, and the ability to clarify and summarize complex issues Ability to work effectively and cross-functionally with all levels of management, both internally and externally Good understanding of the internet industry. Advanced skill in MS Excel, and PowerPoint. Fluent in English. Preferred Qualifications Previous experience or interest working in the gaming industry. - Identify and leverage trends within industry of expertise/focus. Sign in Report this job 6 months maternity cover Responsible of technology leadership, manage and drive implementation and post implementation support of BI platform using Azure BI technology stacks. Drive demand management and capacity planning for BI in the organization for Malaysia, Singapore, and Brunei. Gathering and translating business and/or technical needs into relevant documentation for assigned projects. Influence direction to stakeholders as well as external partners to establish consensus to deliver results. Spot opportunities to share data, insights, algorithms and solution between stake holders in a secure, compliant manner Support maintenance of existing BI reports, Data load, transformation and extraction. Execute daily, weekly and monthly management reports. Maintain and enhance daily automation reports leveraging on existing old (Excel, SAP BI) and new BI platform (Azure BI Stack). Monitor and maintain BI data load in all the platform. Prepare an analysis of costs and benefits so that management can decide if information systems and computing infrastructure upgrades are financially worthwhile. Analyse issues reported by users, resolve issues with or without vendor support. Perform necessary testing and work together with users, global team, and vendors to ensure issues are resolved on time by priority. Follow process for system change management to ensure that changes are compliance with audit requirements. Review automation reports recipient with stakeholder and manager to ensure the list is updated. Review BI security role to ensure the right data access is given for data and reports in BI within the organization. Minimum Bachelor Degree in Computer Science / Information Technology or Engineering with minimum 4 years of experience as in Business Intelligence. Able to convince people through logical, emotional, or cooperative appeals to deliver results Strong critical thinking and decision-making skills Excellent project management skills and strong ability to prioritize Firm graspon IT change management processes Microsoft Certified: Azure Data Engineer Associate Hands on expertise in Azure BI technology Stack, including: Azure Data Factory, Azure Data Lake, Azure Data Bricks, Azure Synapse, Azure Analysis Service, Azure ML Studio, Cosmos DB, Power BI Experience and understanding of a wide variety of analytical processes (data modelling, data acquisition, provenance, ETL, governance, analytical solutions creation). Experience with business driven / self-service BI Experience with Data Science and Predictive Algorithms Experience in Fast Moving Consumer Goods or similar industries will be an advantage. Experience working in a global environment with outsourced offshore partners. Email or phone Password Show Forgot password? Sign in Report this job Prudential’s purpose is to be partners for every life and protectors for every future. Our purpose encourages everything we do by creating a culture in which diversity is celebrated and inclusion assured, for our people, customers, and partners. We provide a platform for our people to do their best work and make an impact to the business, and we support our people’s career ambitions. We pledge to make Prudential a place where you can Connect, Grow, and Succeed. The role is responsible for implementing the analytics solutions within the Transformation Programme. The individual will work with the FFP Data workstream and under the guidance of the MI Product Owner to implement the solution design for the Finance GTP and long-term technology delivery roadmap. The role will require experience and technical knowledge across several data-related domains, including: cloud-based analytics solutions design and architecture, data engineering / programming, data integration & pipeline engineering, data quality, Master data management, data governance & management. The individual will be expected to understand Insurance, Finance and Actuarial data requirements and analytic use cases, and implement the solutions to meet these requirements. Role and Responsibilities Work closely with a project team including the MI tech product owner and end-user analysts at the regional level. Collaborate with stakeholders to understand the analytics use-case requirements, and implementing the analytics solutions. Support the development of an integrated analytics solution supporting the Finance and Actuarial function. Contribute to the creation of a single source of trusted data to meet the needs of the Finance function and wider stakeholders. Drive the development of future-ready Finance analytics systems, emphasizing data process automation. Eliminate manual data processes and interventions, fostering a culture of embedding data within decision-making. Provide challenge proposed designs and solutions within the Future Finance Programme. Qualifications Experience Level: Minimum 5+ years of relevant experience and proven track record as a Solutions Analyst with Finance and insurance domain experience. Education Level: Bachelor’s degree (2:1 honor or higher) or equivalent level Personal Attributes: Strong analytical skills, leadership capabilities, effective communication, and problem-solving ability. Specific Skills: Expertise in analytics solutions design and implementation, data modelling and analytics dashboarding. Certifications: Relevant certifications in data solutions design or related domains. Mandatory Skills Deep technical skills in cloud-based analytics solutions design and delivery, on MS Azure Data modelling and data visualization background in Insurance / Actuarial sectors, including Power BI Broad knowledge of data engineering and data integration application in the market, including Databricks Technology delivery project management experience Relevant programming language skills (eg. SQL, Python, DAX) Awareness of Insurance Finance and Actuarial data requirements Preferred Skills Accreditation in MS Azure, Databricks, Power BI Experience with Cognos. Prudential is an equal opportunity employer. We provide equality of opportunity of benefits for all who apply and who perform work for our organisation irrespective of sex, race, age, ethnic origin, educational, social and cultural background, marital status, pregnancy and maternity, religion or belief, disability or part-time / fixed-term work, or any other status protected by applicable law. We encourage the same standards from our recruitment and third-party suppliers taking into account the context of grade, job and location. We also allow for reasonable adjustments to support people with individual physical or mental health requirements.
